result.execSummary:
The defendant David Allen Westrich Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Costs shall be paid to the Taylor County Clerk of Court at the rate of $100 a month beginning August 4, 2022. Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Defendant is ordered to write a letter of apology to T.W and D.A due within 30 days of sentencing and be pre-approved by the probation agent. Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by the probation agent. Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall comply with AODA and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Allen Westrich Jr.

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make payments, and Order
In court notice to Defendant after sentencing

11:30 AM Defendant David Allen Westrich Jr. in court.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Plea agreement recited into the record. Court finds defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his right to an attorney. Plea of guilty to Count 1 disorderly conduct, domestic abuse. Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1. Court orders sentence withheld and placed on probation for 1 year. Conditions of court costs of $543.00, DNA sample and surcharge, a letter of apology to T.W and D.A due with in 30 days of sentencing to be preapproved by the probation agent. Court orders AODA, follow through with treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the probation agent. Court orders a payment plan, $100 a month beginning 08/04/2022.-JN
on petition for appointment of attorney

11:30 AM Defendant David Allen Westrich Jr. in court.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. David Westrich indicated that he requested a court appointed attorney.
Status hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status hearing on August 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.
Status hearing on June 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.

01:36 PM Defendant David Allen Westrich in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim notification has been complied.  Defendant waives reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Court advised defendant of right to attorney.   Court enters a plea of not guilty on defendant's behalf.  Court orders a cash bond in the amount of $500.00;  booking; no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.  Status hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.
